alert.note: Alert for City of Richmond (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 23 at 1:49PM EDT until June 23 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Virginia, including the following counties and independent cities, Chesterfield, City of Colonial Heights, City of Richmond and Henrico. * WHEN...Until 345 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 149 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Richmond, Petersburg, Colonial Heights, Downtown Richmond, Chester, Bon Air, Virginia Commonwealth University, University Of Richmond, Virginia Union University, Tuckahoe, Highland Springs, Virginia State University, Mechanicsville, Bensley, Chesterfield Court House, Bellwood, East Highland Park, Lakeside, Laurel and Ettrick. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
